summary: Beth Anne Lichtenfels was a Document Control Clerk for the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears in several payroll certifications and reports from October 1977 to March 1979, indicating her employment during that period. Specifically, one document focuses on her payroll records, including authorizations, memos, and injury reports. The documents suggest she was a staff member involved in the administrative operations of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Beth Anne Lichtenfels' significance lies in her role as a staff member within the HSCA, contributing to the administrative and document control aspects of the investigation into the JFK assassination. While not directly involved in investigative activities based on these documents, her role as a Document Control Clerk was essential for the organization and management of information related to the assassination investigation.
